content.raw: This [tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=collide_bitmask&cat=physics) says collisions happen if `collide1 & collide2`. Adding support for category_bitmask means a collision would happen if `(category1 & collide2) | (category2 & collide1)`. This can be made backwards compatible if the category bitmask defaults to the same value as the collide bitmask. The result if category bitmask was not set would be `(collide1 & collide2) | (collide2 & collide1)` which is equivalent to the current behavior.
content.html: This tutorial says collisions happen if collide1 & collide2. Adding support for category_bitmask means a collision would happen if (category1 & collide2) | (category2 & collide1). This can be made backwards compatible if the category bitmask defaults to the same value as the collide bitmask. The result if category bitmask was not set would be (collide1 & collide2) | (collide2 & collide1) which is equivalent to the current behavior.
